# Pinnacle West Capital Corporation (PNW) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Pinnacle West Capital Corporation (NYSE: PNW), through its subsidiary Arizona Public Service (APS), provides retail and wholesale electric services primarily in the state of Arizona. The company engages in the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity using nuclear, gas, oil, coal, and solar generating facilities. APS serves approximately 1.4 million customers across a 35,000-square-mile territory in central Arizona, including the Phoenix area. Pinnacle West Capital Corporation was incorporated in 1985 and is headquartered in Phoenix, Arizona.

APS owns or leases 6.5 gigawatts of power generation capacity, including a 29% ownership stake in one of the largest nuclear plants in the US, Palo Verde. Half of the electricity that APS supplies to customers comes from clean energy sources, including nuclear. APS is the largest utility company in Arizona and is regulated by the Arizona Corporation Commission (ACC).

## 2. Current Market Data

Today Pinnacle West Capital Corporation has the market capitalization of ‪10.69 B‬, it has increased by 2.49% over the last week. The company has a PE Ratio (TTM) of 17.92, EPS (TTM) of 4.85, and Forward Dividend & Yield of 3.64 (4.13%). As of today, Dividend Yield (TTM)% is 4.02%. Pinnacle West Capital Corporation EBITDA is ‪1.85 B‬ USD, and current EBITDA margin is 40.13%.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The company engages in the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity using nuclear, gas, oil, coal, and solar generating facilities. Its transmission facilities include overhead lines and underground lines; and distribution facilities consist of overhead lines and underground primary cables. The company also owns and maintains transmission and distribution substations; and owns energy storage facilities.

APS is owner and operator of Palo Verde Generating Station, one of the nation's largest producers of carbon-free electricity, and with one of the country's most substantial renewable energy portfolios, APS's current energy mix is 51% clean. Arizona Public Service (APS) owns 29.1% of, and operates the plant.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### Desert Sun Power Plant Project

Arizona Public Service (APS) announced plans today to develop a site west of Gila Bend, Ariz., capable of adding up to 2,000 megawatts (MW) of reliable, flexible generation to the state's energy portfolio. The Desert Sun Power Plant will be a state-of-the-art natural gas facility designed to meet Arizona's rapidly growing needs, support unprecedented demand from extra-large energy users and enhance integration of renewable energy resources – all while protecting affordability for residential and small business customers.

This two-phase project will support current customer growth through our competitive procurement process in Phase 1 and enable new extra-large customer investments via an innovative subscription model in Phase 2. Phase 1 of the power plant is scheduled to begin serving customers by late 2030; Phase 2's operation date will be determined through a collaborative process with participating extra-large customers.

### Major Infrastructure Expansion

To prioritize reliability and meet requirements of this substantial growth, APS expects to add 9,805 megawatts (MW) of renewable power, battery storage and natural gas to the grid between 2025 and 2028 – more than 90% of which will be carbon-free. Some expansion highlights include: Power purchase agreements that are expected to add 3,321 MW of solar power along with 168 MW from the APS-owned Ironwood Solar Plant, currently under construction in Yuma County. At the Agave Solar Plant in Maricopa County, construction is under way on 150 MW of battery storage that will deliver solar energy to customers after sunset. Power purchase agreements for an anticipated 5,087 MW of battery energy storage that grid operators can release during evening hours when customer demand is greatest.

## 5. Growth Strategy

These investments are expected to drive rate base growth of 7% to 9% through 2028, an increase from our prior guidance of 6% to 8% through 2027. To support this plan, we've updated our financing strategy for 2026 through 2028, maintaining a balanced mix of debt and equity aligned with our balance sheet targets.

The company also announced an increase in its annual rate base growth projection to 7-9% for the 2024-2028 period and raised its long-term sales growth forecast to 5-7% through 2030.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

At the same time, demand from extra-large energy users has surged, with requests exceeding 19,000 MW – more than double APS's 2025 peak energy demand record of 8,631 MW. APS currently has about 30 data centers in its interconnection queue, requesting a combined 18GW of power.

Arizona is fast becoming a regional hub for data centers, with upwards of 129 data centers currently operating in the state. Hyperscalers, Meta, AWS, Google, and Microsoft all have a presence in the state.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Recent Earnings Performance
Pinnacle West Capital Corp. (NYSE: PNW) today reported consolidated net income attributable to common shareholders for the 2025 third quarter of $413.2 million, or $3.39 per diluted share of common stock. This result compares with consolidated net income of $395.0 million, or $3.37 per share of common stock, for the same period a year ago.

Pinnacle West Capital Corp. (NYSE: PNW) today reported consolidated net income attributable to common shareholders of $608.8 million, or $5.24 per diluted share, for full-year 2024.

### Updated Guidance
Given the positive customer and sales growth and impact of weather and through the first three quarters of the year – partially offset by higher than previously forecasted operations and maintenance expenses – the company is adjusting its 2025 consolidated earnings guidance upward to a range of $4.90 to $5.10 per diluted share. Looking forward, the Company estimates its 2026 consolidated earnings will be within a range of $4.55 to $4.75 per diluted share on a weather-normalized basis.

### Financing Strategy
For 2026, approximately 85% of our equity need has already been priced, with an additional $1 billion to $1.2 billion of Pinnacle West equity forecasted through 2028.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Tailwinds
- **Population Growth**: According to the U.S. Census Bureau, annual population gains in Maricopa County (home of the Phoenix metropolitan area) are among the highest in the United States since 2016. Site Selection Magazine recently named Maricopa County the top U.S. region for economic development, fueled in part by Phoenix's tech momentum and advanced manufacturing boom.

- **Record Demand**: On August 7, Arizona Public Service (APS) customers set an all-time record peak demand of 8,631 megawatts (MW), the third time this summer that demand surpassed the previous record set in 2024. These milestones mark the third consecutive year of record-breaking summer demand and underscore the strength of APS's careful, long-term planning for adequate resources.

- **Data Center Boom**: Arizona Public Service (APS) plans to build the Desert Sun Power Plant, a new natural gas facility west of Gila Bend, to address an "unprecedented" surge in energy demand, driven largely by new data centers running artificial intelligence programs.

### Headwinds
- **Regulatory Uncertainty**: Utility regulation in Arizona has a history of political influence, creating more regulatory uncertainty than at other utilities and raising risk for shareholders.

- **Regulatory Lag**: Regulatory lag -- Acknowledged as an ongoing issue for 2026, but being addressed through rate case and formula rate mechanisms.

- **Weather Dependency**: While our second-quarter financial results were within our expectations, they were lower than the same period in 2024 due in large part to cooler weather compared to last year's record-high temperatures.

## 9. Market Shares

The major retailers of electricity in Arizona are Arizona Public Service, Salt River Project and Tucson Electric Power. Arizona Public Service is the largest electric company and electricity provider in Arizona. APS serves about two-thirds of the Phoenix metropolitan area. It primarily serves downtown and northern Phoenix, a large swath to the north and west of the city, and the downtown areas of Chandler, Gilbert, Glendale, Peoria, Scottsdale and Tempe.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

Regionally, the Western grid is the competitive arena Pinnacle West Capital also effectively competes with other Western utilities such as Salt River Project (SRP, a major Arizona player), NV Energy, and the California IOUs (PG&E, SCE).

Salt River Project: SRP is a community-based, not-for-profit public power utility and the largest provider of electricity in the greater Phoenix metropolitan area, serving more than 1 million customers. SRP is also the metropolitan area's largest supplier of water, delivering about 800,000 acre-feet annually to municipal, urban and agricultural water users.

Tucson Electric Power and UniSource Energy Services: TEP serves more than 450,000 electric customers in Southern Arizona. UniSource provides electric service to more than 100,000 customers in Northern and Southern Arizona.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

Today, Arizona Public Service (APS), Salt River Project (SRP), Tucson Electric Power (TEP) and UniSource Energy Services announced plans to join Southwest Power Pool's (SPP) Markets+ a day-ahead and real-time energy market that is anticipated to span through the northwest, southwest and mountain west regions of the U.S. The new market is expected to bring enhanced reliability and savings of nearly $100 million above current market participation, passed back across the electric companies' customers.

In August, APS, alongside the Salt River Project, announced that it would acquire capacity from Energy Transfer's Transwestern Pipeline Desert Southwest expansion project. The pipeline currently spans 2,590 miles, delivering 0.9 billion cubic feet a day (Bcf/day) of gas from the Permian Basin in southwest Texas to Arizona. The expansion - expected to cost around $5.3 billion - will expand the system by 516 miles and add 1.5 Bcf per day of capacity to the system.

## 12. Recent Developments

- **Q3 2025 Earnings Beat**: The utility company reported third-quarter 2025 results of $3.39 per share, exceeding both the consensus estimate of $3.07 and BMO's estimate of $3.03. This strong performance contributes to PNW's trailing twelve-month diluted EPS of $4.92.

- **Raised Guidance**: The move from a range of US$4.40–$4.60 to US$4.90–$5.10 per diluted share reflects stronger-than-expected customer and sales growth so far this year, partially offset by higher operations and maintenance expenses.

- **Desert Sun Project**: Arizona Public Service (APS) announced plans today to develop a site west of Gila Bend, Ariz., capable of adding up to 2,000 megawatts (MW) of reliable, flexible generation to the state's energy portfolio. The Desert Sun Power Plant will be a state-of-the-art natural gas facility designed to meet Arizona's rapidly growing needs.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Analyst Consensus
The 11 analysts that cover Pinnacle West Capital stock have a consensus rating of "Buy" and an average price target of $96.45, which forecasts a 11.16% increase in the stock price over the next year. Pinnacle West Capital Corp has a consensus rating of Hold which is based on 0 buy ratings, 8 hold ratings and 0 sell ratings.

### Valuation Assessment
Based on the comprehensive analysis:

**Strengths:**
- Strong operational performance with consistent record demand
- Strategic positioning in Arizona's rapidly growing market
- Substantial infrastructure investment pipeline
- Diversified energy portfolio including nuclear assets
- Innovative financing strategies for growth projects

**Risks:**
- Regulatory uncertainty in Arizona
- Weather dependency affecting earnings
- Significant capital investment requirements
- Competition from other Arizona utilities

**AI Investment Rating: 7.2/10**

This rating reflects a "Buy/Hold" recommendation for moderate-risk growth investors. The company demonstrates strong fundamentals with significant growth opportunities driven by Arizona's population boom and data center expansion, but faces regulatory headwinds and substantial capital requirements.

**Estimated Fair Value: $98-$102**

Based on analyst price targets averaging $96.45, the company's growth trajectory, and infrastructure investment pipeline, the fair value appears to be in the $98-$102 range, suggesting modest upside from current levels while accounting for execution risks and regulatory challenges.
tldr_summary:
Pinnacle West Capital Corporation, through Arizona Public Service (APS), is a utility company providing electricity generation, transmission, and distribution services primarily in Arizona, serving 1.4 million customers across a 35,000-square-mile territory.

Key highlights include aggressive expansion into renewable and clean energy, with plans to add 9,805 megawatts of carbon-free power by 2028 and a new 2,000-megawatt Desert Sun Power Plant. The company is experiencing significant growth driven by Arizona's booming population and data center expansion, with hyperscalers like Meta, AWS, and Google increasing regional energy demand. APS owns substantial nuclear generation capacity and is diversifying its energy portfolio, targeting 51% clean energy. The company faces regulatory challenges but has a strong market position as Arizona's largest utility, with a strategic focus on infrastructure investment and meeting rapidly growing energy needs.

The AI investment rating is 7.2/10 (Buy/Hold), with an estimated fair value of $98-$102, reflecting moderate growth potential balanced against regulatory and capital investment risks.
